metadata.title: Guidance | LocalDesk Denmark
metadata.description: Step-by-step guides for navigating life in Denmark. From your first week to long-term settlement, follow our proven roadmaps for success.

Hero.label: Guidance
Hero.title: Navigate
Hero.description: Clear, actionable guides for every stage of your
Hero.subtitle: From your first week to long-term settlement, follow our step-by-step guides to navigate complex processes with ease.

firstWeek.title: Your First Week in Denmark
firstWeek.description: Essential steps to take immediately upon arrival

step1.title: Secure Temporary Accommodation
step1.description: Find a place to stay while you search for permanent housing
details: Book hotel or Airbnb for first few days
Contact your employer about temporary housing

step2.title: Get a Danish SIM Card
step2.description: Essential for communication and many services
details: Choose prepaid (50-200 DKK) or postpaid (100-500 DKK/month)
Prepaid good for temporary residents, postpaid for long-term

step4.title: Start Housing Search
details: Budget: 8,000-15,000 DKK/month for 1-bedroom in Copenhagen (lower in other cities)

step1.title: Register for CPR Number
step1.description: Your key to accessing all Danish services
details: Book appointment at ICS or Borgerservice
Bring passport, residence permit, rental contract

step2.title: Set Up MitID
details: Essential for banking and government services

step3.title: Open Bank Account
step3.description: Necessary for salary and bill payments
details: Bring passport and proof of address
Compare banks: Danske Bank, Nordea, Jyske Bank
Set up NemKonto for government payments

step4.title: Apply for Tax Card
details: Choose hovedkort (main card) for primary job
Employer needs your tax card information

housingGuide.title: Finding and Securing Housing
housingGuide.description: Navigate the Danish rental market successfully

step1.title: Understand Housing Types
details: Private rental: Most flexible, higher cost
Social housing: Lower cost, long waiting lists
Student housing: For enrolled students only

step2.title: Search on Multiple Platforms
step2.description: Cast a wide net for opportunities
details: Real estate agents: For higher-end rentals

step3.title: Prepare Financial Documentation
details: Budget for deposit: 3-6 months rent upfront

step4.title: Review Rental Contract Carefully
details: Check rent amount and payment terms

taxGuide.title: Understanding Your Taxes
taxGuide.description: Navigate the Danish tax system with confidence

step1.title: Understand Tax Structure
details: Top tax: 15% on income above ~588,900 DKK
Total effective rate: 38-52% depending on income

step2.title: Get Your Tax Card
details: Apply via TastSelv on SKAT.dk with MitID
Employer uses this to withhold correct tax

step3.title: Know Your Deductions
details: Transport: Commuting costs over 24 km each way
Union fees: A-kasse and union membership
Charitable donations: To approved organizations (minimum 500 DKK/year)

step4.title: Review Annual Tax Return
details: Receive refund or pay additional tax

step1.title: Get Health Insurance Card
details: Yellow card arrives by mail in 2-4 weeks
Shows your CPR number and assigned GP

step2.title: Register with GP
details: GP is first point of contact for health issues

step3.title: Understand Healthcare System
details: Pharmacy: Prescription required for most medications
Dental: Not covered, private insurance recommended

step4.title: Access Digital Health Services
details: Min Læge app: Contact your GP

metadata.title: Privacy Policy - LocalDesk
metadata.description: Privacy policy and data protection information for LocalDesk

PrivacyPage.title: Privacy Policy
PrivacyPage.introduction: At LocalDesk, we take your privacy seriously. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our service. We are committed to protecting your personal data in accordance with GDPR and Danish data protection laws.

personalInfo.title: Personal Information
personalInfo.intro: When you create an account, we collect:

usageInfo.title: Usage Information
usageInfo.intro: We automatically collect certain information when you use our service:

dataUse.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
dataUse.intro: We use the collected information to:

items.provide: Provide and maintain our AI-powered assistant service
items.personalize: Personalize your experience and improve our recommendations
items.process: Process your requests and respond to your inquiries
items.notify: Send you service updates and important notifications
items.analyze: Analyze usage patterns to improve our service
items.prevent: Detect and prevent fraud or abuse

legalBasis.title: 3. Legal Basis for Processing (GDPR)
legalBasis.intro: Under GDPR, we process your personal data based on:

items.consent: Consent: You have given clear consent for us to process your personal data for specific purposes
items.contract: Contract: Processing is necessary to fulfill our contract with you (providing the service)
items.legal: Legal obligation: Processing is necessary to comply with the law
items.legitimate: Legitimate interests: Processing is necessary for our legitimate interests (improving our service, preventing fraud)

dataSharing.title: 4. Data Sharing and Disclosure
dataSharing.intro: We do not sell your personal information. We may share your data with:

legal.title: Legal Requirements
legal.description: We may disclose your information if required by law or in response to valid legal requests.

dataSecurity.title: 5. Data Storage and Security
dataSecurity.intro: Your data is stored securely using industry-standard encryption and security measures. We use:

items.database: Secure database storage with access controls
items.datacenters: Data centers located in the EU (GDPR compliant)

dataSecurity.disclaimer: However, no method of transmission over the internet is 100% secure. While we strive to protect your data, we cannot guarantee absolute security.

userRights.title: 6. Your Rights Under GDPR
userRights.intro: As a user in the EU, you have the following rights:

items.access: Right to Access: Request a copy of your personal data
items.rectification: Right to Rectification: Correct inaccurate or incomplete data
items.erasure: Right to Erasure: Request deletion of your personal data ("right to be forgotten")
items.restrict: Right to Restrict Processing: Limit how we use your data
items.portability: Right to Data Portability: Receive your data in a structured, machine-readable format
items.object: Right to Object: Object to processing based on legitimate interests
items.withdraw: Right to Withdraw Consent: Withdraw consent at any time

userRights.contact: To exercise these rights, contact us at hello@localdesk.dk

cookies.title: 7. Cookies and Tracking
cookies.intro: We use cookies and similar technologies to:

items.session: Maintain your session and keep you logged in

cookies.control: You can control cookies through your browser settings. Note that disabling cookies may affect functionality.

dataRetention.title: 8. Data Retention
dataRetention.intro: We retain your personal data only as long as necessary to provide our services and comply with legal obligations:

items.account: Account data: Retained while your account is active
items.chat: Chat history: Retained for service improvement unless you request deletion
items.logs: Usage logs: Typically retained for 90 days
items.legal: Legal records: Retained as required by law

dataRetention.deletion: When you delete your account, we will delete or anonymize your personal data within 30 days, except where we are required to retain it by law.

internationalTransfers.title: 9. International Data Transfers
internationalTransfers.intro: Your data is primarily stored within the European Union. If we transfer data outside the EU, we ensure appropriate safeguards are in place, such as:

items.adequacy: Adequacy decisions by the European Commission

childrenPrivacy.title: 10. Children's Privacy
childrenPrivacy.description: Our service is not intended for children under 16 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If you believe we have collected data from a child, please contact us immediately.

policyChanges.title: 11. Changes to This Policy
policyChanges.intro: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of significant changes by:

items.posting: Posting the updated policy on our website
items.email: Sending email notifications for material changes

policyChanges.acceptance: Your continued use of the service after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

contact.title: 12. Contact Us
contact.intro: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or wish to exercise your rights, please contact us:
contact.complaint: You also have the right to lodge a complaint with the Danish Data Protection Agency (Datatilsynet) if you believe we have not handled your data appropriately.

cta.title: Your Privacy Matters
cta.description: We're committed to protecting your data and respecting your privacy rights. If you have any concerns or questions, we're here to help.

metadata.title: Terms of Service - LocalDesk
metadata.description: Terms and conditions for using LocalDesk services

TermsPage.title: Terms of Service
TermsPage.introduction: Welcome to LocalDesk. By accessing or using our service, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. Please read them carefully before using our platform.

acceptance.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By creating an account or using LocalDesk, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service and our Privacy Policy. If you do not agree to these terms, you may not access or use our services.

serviceDescription.title: 2. Service Description
serviceDescription.content: LocalDesk provides an AI-powered assistant to help users navigate Danish bureaucracy, including information about taxes, visas, housing, and other administrative matters. Our service is informational in nature and should not be considered as legal, financial, or professional advice. Always consult with qualified professionals for specific guidance.

userAccounts.title: 3. User Accounts
userAccounts.intro: To access certain features, you must create an account. You are responsible for:

items.confidentiality: Maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials
items.activities: All activities that occur under your account
items.unauthorized: Notifying us immediately of any unauthorized access

items.illegal: Use the service for any illegal or unauthorized purpose
items.access: Attempt to gain unauthorized access to our systems
items.interfere: Interfere with or disrupt the service or servers
items.automated: Use automated systems to access the service without permission
items.malicious: Transmit any malicious code or harmful content

intellectualProperty.title: 5. Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.content: All content, features, and functionality of LocalDesk, including but not limited to text, graphics, logos, and software, are owned by LocalDesk and protected by international copyright, trademark, and other intellectual property laws. You may not reproduce, distribute, modify, or create derivative works without our express written permission.

dataPrivacy.title: 6. Data and Privacy
dataPrivacy.content: Your use of LocalDesk is also governed by our Privacy Policy. We collect and process personal data in accordance with GDPR and Danish data protection laws. By using our service, you consent to the collection and use of information as described in our Privacy Policy.

disclaimerWarranties.title: 7. Disclaimer of Warranties
disclaimerWarranties.intro: LocalDesk is provided "as is" and "as available" without warranties of any kind, either express or implied. We do not guarantee that:

items.uninterrupted: The service will be uninterrupted or error-free
items.accurate: All information provided is accurate or complete
items.requirements: The service will meet your specific requirements
items.corrected: Any errors or defects will be corrected

limitationLiability.title: 8. Limitation of Liability
limitationLiability.content: To the maximum extent permitted by law, LocalDesk shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages resulting from your use or inability to use the service. This includes, but is not limited to, damages for loss of profits, data, or other intangible losses.

termination.title: 9. Termination
termination.intro: We reserve the right to suspend or terminate your account and access to the service at our sole discretion, without notice, for conduct that we believe:

items.harmful: Is harmful to other users or our business

termination.userTermination: You may terminate your account at any time by contacting us or using the account deletion feature.

changesTerms.title: 10. Changes to Terms
changesTerms.intro: We reserve the right to modify these Terms of Service at any time. We will notify users of any material changes by:

items.posting: Posting the updated terms on our website
items.email: Sending email notifications for significant changes

changesTerms.acceptance: Your continued use of the service after changes constitutes acceptance of the modified terms.

governingLaw.title: 11. Governing Law
governingLaw.content: These Terms of Service shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Denmark, without regard to its conflict of law provisions. Any disputes arising from these terms shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Denmark.

contact.title: 12. Contact Information
contact.intro: If you have any questions about these Terms of Service, please contact us at:

cta.title: Need Help?
cta.description: Have questions about our terms or how we handle your data? We're here to help.
